title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1290.3 - Authorization required for commercial activity, entertainment or solicitation of funds
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1290.3 - Authorization required for commercial activity, entertainment or solicitation of funds

State Regulations

No person at the World Trade Center, unless duly authorized
in writing by the Port Authority, shall: (a) sell, or offer for sale any articles of
merchandise or carry on any other commercial activity; or
(b) solicit any business or trade, or perform
or offer to perform any service, including without limitation thereto the
carrying of baggage for hire, the shining of shoes or bootblacking; or
(c) entertain or offer to
entertain any persons by any method including without limitation thereto by
singing, dancing or playing any musical instrument; or
(d) canvass, peddle, or solicit funds for any
purpose. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1290.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
